text:
Hi guys,
We have a client who really loves the HubSpot Blog page (<https://blog.HubSpot.com/>) and wants to know if we can recreate it...
They'd like use to display both blog posts and static blocks like the HS blog page, in a form of masonry layout. Usually I'd display blog posts using the RSS module, but I'm not sure how I'd combine posts and static blocks

Inspecting their code it looks like they have a loop that pulls in a featured blog post (or perhaps just the latest one) and next to that is the sidebar with most popular/editors picks lists.

Then they use another loop to render the rest of the blog posts. On loop index 3 and 4 they insert the "subscribe" and "free marketing resources" CTAs.

Seems like they also use loop index conditionals to insert classes on the blog post divs that control if they are one-third or two-third in size
Okay makes sense, will have a play around with it. Thanks for the breakdown :thumbsup:
I bet there's a way to do it using CSS Grid too, put the work on CSS rather than overcomplicating your markup
The layout side of things, I'm confident in replicating, more the functionality of rendering both blog posts and static/module blocks amongst a grid
You can use a page and pull in the loops and link off to the older posts

Has anyone found a way to easily integrate the HubSpot blog (via RSS feed or otherwise) into a WordPress site? We have a lot of clients that have their sites built in WordPress, and I need to be able to pull specific blog categories into various pages on the site.
We received a message asking about a new CMS for HubSpot. Am I missing something or is this just DM2?
